revisions.rev:
{{main|Timeline of Occupy Wall Street}} The [[Occupy movement]] has notably clashed with law enforcement agencies on many occasions. <!-- ==By date== * Oct 14 ** 39 arrests in Sacramento
* Oct 16 ** 85 arrests in Tuscon ** 175 arrests in Chicago * Oct 23 ** 130 arrests in Chicago * Oct 24 ** 110 arrests in Tuscon * Oct 26 ** First Oakland raid, Scott Olsen injured. 105 arrests. * Oct 27 ** 44 arrests in San Diego * Oct 28 ** 51 arrests in San Diego * Oct 30
* Nov 2 ** 101 arrests in second raid of Oakland, Scott Campbell shooting, Kayvan Sabeghi beaten. * Nov 7 ** 47 arrests in Chicago * Nov 12 ** 91 arrests in Salt Lake City. ** 17 arrests in Denver. * Nov 14 ** Third Oakland raid * Nov 15 ** 2:00 AM, NYPD raids Zucotti park. ~200 arrests. ** Seattle raided ** Phoenix raided ==By Location== * Austin ** Oct 29 - 4538 arrested. ** Nov 13 - 36 arrested. * Chicago * Denver ** Nov 12 - Camp demolished. Rubber bullets and pepper spray used. 52 arrested. ** Nov 13 - 15 arrests. * Nashville ** Nov 11 - 46 arrested, Magistrate throws out charges. ** Nov 12 - 26 arrested, again magistrate throws out charges. * New York City ** Nov 15 - Zucotti Park raided, ~200 arrests. * Oakland ** Oct 26 - First Oakland raid, Scott Olsen injured. 105 arrests. ** Nov 2 - 101 arrests in second raid of Oakland, Scott Campbell shooting, Kayvan Sabeghi beaten. ** Nov 14 - Third Oakland raid, 33 arrested. * Portland ** Oct 30 - 27 arrested ** Nov 13 - two camps destroyed, 30 arrests * San Diego ** Nov 11 - 44 arrested, camp demolished * Rochester ** Nov 12 - 32 arrested, camp demolished * Salt Lake City * Seattle * St. Louis -->
==Prior to Nov 9==
* Sept 24 - [[Occupy Wall Street]], 80 arrests. Deputy Inspector Anthony Bologna was filmed using chemical spray on several penned-in female demonstrators and later using the spray on a media. * Oct 1 - [[Occupy Wall Street]], 700 arrests at the [[Brooklyn Bridge]]. * Oct 15 - In Chicago there were 175 arrests, about 100 arrests in Arizona (53 in Tucson, 46 in Phoenix), and more than 70 in New York City, including at least 40 in Times Square.<ref>{{cite web |author=Associated Press October 16, 2011, 11:02 pm |url=http://www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/nation/la-na-occupy-wall-street-20111017,0,7374570.story |title=Hundreds arrested in 'Occupy' protests |work=Los Angeles Times |date=July 13, 2011 |accessdate=October 19, 2011}}</ref> * Nov 2-3 - [[Occupy Oakland]] -- Scott Campbell shot while filming police[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I0pX9LeE-g8], Kayvan Sabeghi beating[http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/video/2011/nov/18/occupy-oakland-veteran-beaten-police-video] , 103 arrests<ref>[http://sanfrancisco.cbslocal.com/2011/11/03/occupy-oakland-disavows-violence-police-report-103-arrests Occupy Oakland Disavows Violence - Police report 103 arrests]</ref>
==Nov 9 - 16== Major occupations in the USâ Portland, Phoenix, Salt Lake City, Seattle, Denver, Oakland, San Francisco, New York * Friday, Nov 11 ** St. Louis camp demolished, 27 arrests.<ref name="infographic">[http://www.metro.us/newyork/national/article/1025193--updated-were-this-week-s-occupy-movement-crackdowns-a-coordinated-effort Infographic] on raids</ref> * Saturday, Nov 12 ** Salt Lake City camp demolished, 18 arrests.<ref name="infographic"/> ** Denver camp demolished, 17 arrests.<ref name="infographic"/> * Sunday, Nov 13 ** Portland camp demolished, >50 arrests <ref name="infographic"/> * Monday, Nov 14 ** Oakland camp demolished, tear gas used, 33 arrests.<ref name="infographic"/> * Tues, Nov 15 ** Occupy Wall Street camp in Zucotti Park demolished, ~200 arrests, including at least five journalists.<ref name="infographic"/> ** [[Occupy Seattle|Seattle camp]] demolished, protesters pepper-sprayed.
==Sources== * [http://occupyarrests.wordpress.com OccupyArrests] and [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/pub?hl=en_US&hl=en_US&key=0Ales8jo3cdcYdEVqZ0pZLTBmSGVGeTVKVmMwc1RpaHc&output=html tabulated arrests] * [http://www.metro.us/newyork/national/article/1025193--updated-were-this-week-s-occupy-movement-crackdowns-a-coordinated-effort Infographic] on raids
